titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

p.hi: The fine weather continues. I received from

An interesting book, which throws light on the life & manners of the XViii
century, was commended to me, & I read much of it in the course of the afternoon, "
Memoirs of an Eighteenth Century Footman, John Macdonald. Travels, (1745–1779). With an Introduction by John Beresford, Editor of "The Diary of a Country Parson" George Routledge & Sons, Ltd. 1927
. The relation between the gentleman and his servant was very remarkable. Intimacy and freedom of speech went along with the acceptance of a complete division of status – a very Caste system.
